xxl.core.io.fat

Class DIR.DirectoryStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.fat.DIR.DirectoryStructure
  • Enclosing class:
    DIR

    protected class DIR.DirectoryStructure
extends Object
    Inner class represents one entry of the directory. One entry consists of 32 bytes. Since the naming convention is no longer restricted to 8.3 one entry may be consist of x*32 bytes. Where x is a positive non zero integer.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected short attributes
      Attributes of the directory entry.
      protected long clusterNumber
      The number of the cluster where the directory entry should be stored.
      protected int creationDate
      The date stamp the file was created.

      The time stamp the file was created.

      Millisecond stamp at file creation time.

      The length of the file stored at the directory entry.
      protected int firstClusterHI
      The high part of the cluster number stored at the directory entry.
      protected int firstClusterLO
      The low part of the cluster number stored at the directory entry.
      protected boolean isRoot
      Indicates if the clusterNumber belongs to the root directory.
      protected int lastAccessDate
      The date stamp the file was last accessed.
      protected String longName
      Long name representation of the directory name, in case the given directory name is not storable as shortName.
      protected int numOfEntries
      Contains the number of entries that this directory entry uses.
      protected String shortName
      Short name representation of the directory name.
      protected int writeDate
      The date stamp the file was last written.
      protected int writeTime
      The time stamp the file was last written.

    • Field Detail

      • shortName

        protected String shortName
        Short name representation of the directory name. The format is 8.3.

      • longName

        protected String longName
        Long name representation of the directory name, in case the given directory name is not storable as shortName.

      • attributes

        protected short attributes
        Attributes of the directory entry.

      • creationTimeTenth

        protected short creationTimeTenth
        Millisecond stamp at file creation time. This field actually contains a count of tenths of a second. The granularity of the seconds part of creationTime is 2 seconds so this field is a count of tenths of a second and its value range is 0-199 inclusive.

      • creationTime

        protected int creationTime
        The time stamp the file was created. A time stamp is a 16-bit field that has a granularity of 2 seconds. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word. Bits 0-4: 2-second count, valid range 0-29 inclusive (0-58 seconds). Bits 5-10: Minutes, valid value range 0-59 inclusive. Bits 11-15: Hours, valid range 0-23 inclusive.

      • creationDate

        protected int creationDate
        The date stamp the file was created. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107).

      • lastAccessDate

        protected int lastAccessDate
        The date stamp the file was last accessed. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107).

      • firstClusterHI

        protected int firstClusterHI
        The high part of the cluster number stored at the directory entry.

      • writeTime

        protected int writeTime
        The time stamp the file was last written. A time stamp is a 16-bit field that has a granularity of 2 seconds. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word. Bits 0-4: 2-second count, valid range 0-29 inclusive (0-58 seconds). Bits 5-10: Minutes, valid value range 0-59 inclusive. Bits 11-15: Hours, valid range 0-23 inclusive.

      • writeDate

        protected int writeDate
        The date stamp the file was last written. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107).

      • firstClusterLO

        protected int firstClusterLO
        The low part of the cluster number stored at the directory entry.

      • fileSize

        protected long fileSize
        The length of the file stored at the directory entry.

      • clusterNumber

        protected long clusterNumber
        The number of the cluster where the directory entry should be stored.

      • isRoot

        protected boolean isRoot
        Indicates if the clusterNumber belongs to the root directory.

      • numOfEntries

        protected int numOfEntries
        Contains the number of entries that this directory entry uses.

      • DirectoryStructure

        public DirectoryStructure(String name,
                          long clusterNumber,
                          boolean isRoot)
                   throws IllegalName
        Creates an instance of this object.
        Parameters:
        name - the name stored at the directory entry.
        clusterNumber - the number of the cluster where the directory should be stored.
        isRoot - indicates if the given clusterNumber belongs to the root directory.
        Throws:
        IllegalName - in case the given name is not legal.

      • DirectoryStructure

        public DirectoryStructure(String name,
                          byte attribute,
                          int crtTimeHour,
                          int crtTimeMinute,
                          int crtTimeSecond,
                          int crtTimeMillisecond,
                          int crtDateDayOfMonth,
                          int crtDateMonth,
                          int crtDateYear,
                          long entryClusterNumber,
                          long fileSize,
                          long clusterNumber,
                          boolean isRoot)
                   throws IllegalName
        Creates an instance of this object.
        Parameters:
        name - the name stored at the directory entry.
        attribute - the attribute stored at the directory entry.
        crtTimeHour - creation time hour valid range form 1 to 24.
        crtTimeMinute - creation time minute valid range from 0 to 59.
        crtTimeSecond - creation time second valid range from 0 to 59.
        crtTimeMillisecond - creation time millisecond valid range from 0 to 999.
        crtDateDayOfMonth - creation day valid range from 1 to 31.
        crtDateMonth - creation month valid range from 1 to 12.
        crtDateYear - creation year.
        entryClusterNumber - the number of the cluster stored at the directory entry.
        fileSize - the size of the file stored at the directory entry.
        clusterNumber - the number of the cluster where the directory should be stored.
        isRoot - indicates if the given clusterNumber belongs to the root directory.
        Throws:
        IllegalName - in case the given name is not legal.

      • DirectoryStructure

        public DirectoryStructure(byte[] dirStruc,
                          long clusterNumber,
                          boolean isRoot)
        Initialize this directory entry with the given byte array. All variables will be initialized.
        Parameters:
        dirStruc - a directory entry as byte array, the length has to be a multiple of 32 byte.
        clusterNumber - is the number of the cluster where the directory entry is taken from. It is needed because of the numeric tail of the short name.
        isRoot - indicates if the given clusterNumber belongs to the root directory.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(String str)
             throws IllegalName
        Set the name of a file or directory. There are some restrictions on the name.
        Parameters:
        str - the name, it can be either a short name with 8.3 naming convention or a long name.
        Throws:
        IllegalName - in case the name is not legal.

      • setClusterNumber

        public void setClusterNumber(long clusterNumber)
        Set the cluster number of this entry to the given clusterNumber.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - number of cluster to set.

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(short attribute)
        Set the attribute. Only the first 6 bits are free to change. The upper 2 bit (of the byte type) are reserved.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute for the directory entry.

      • setCreationTime

        public void setCreationTime()
        Set the creationTime to the actual time. A time stamp is a 16-bit field that has a granularity of 2 seconds. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word. Bits 0-4: 2-second count, valid range 0-29 inclusive (0-58 seconds). Bits 5-10: Minutes, valid value range 0-59 inclusive. Bits 11-15: Hours, valid range 0-23 inclusive.

      • setCreationTime

        public void setCreationTime(int crtTimeHour,
                            int crtTimeMinute,
                            int crtTimeSecond,
                            int crtTimeMillisecond)
        Set the creationTime to the given parameters. A time stamp is a 16-bit field that has a granularity of 2 seconds. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word. Bits 0-4: 2-second count, valid range 0-29 inclusive (0-58 seconds). Bits 5-10: Minutes, valid value range 0-59 inclusive. Bits 11-15: Hours, valid range 0-23 inclusive. All parameter must be in the valid range, no conversion will be done.
        Parameters:
        crtTimeHour - creation time hour.
        crtTimeMinute - creation time minute.
        crtTimeSecond - creation time second.
        crtTimeMillisecond - creation time millisecond

      • setCreationDate

        public void setCreationDate()
        Set the creationDate to the actual date. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107).

      • setCreationDate

        public void setCreationDate(int crtDateDayOfMonth,
                            int crtDateMonth,
                            int countOfYears)
        Set the creationDate to the actual date. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107). All parameter must be in the valid range, no conversion will be done.
        Parameters:
        crtDateDayOfMonth - creation day.
        crtDateMonth - creation month.
        countOfYears - the count of years since 1980.

      • setLastAccessDate

        public void setLastAccessDate(int dayOfMonth,
                              int month,
                              int year)
        Set the last access to the actual date. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107). All parameter must be in the valid range, no conversion will be done.
        Parameters:
        dayOfMonth - last access day.
        month - last access month.
        year - last access year.

        public void setLastAccessDate()
        Set the last access date with the actual time.

        public void setLastWriteDate(int dayOfMonth,
                             int month,
                             int year)
        Set the last write date to the actual date. A date stamp is a 16-bit field that that is basically a date relative to the MS-DOS epoch of 01/01/1980. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word: Bits 0-4: Day, valid range 1-31 inclusive. Bits 5-8: Month, 1=January, valid range 1-12 inclusive. Bits 9-15: Count of years from 1980, valid range 0-127 inclusive (1980-2107). All parameter must be in the valid range, no conversion will be done.
        Parameters:
        dayOfMonth - last write day.
        month - last write month.
        year - last write year.

      • setLastWriteDate

        public void setLastWriteDate()

      • setLastWriteTime

        public void setLastWriteTime(int hour,
                             int minute,
                             int second)
        Set the last write time to the given parameters. A time stamp is a 16-bit field that has a granularity of 2 seconds. Bit 0 is the LSB of the 16-bit word, bit 15 is the MSB of the 16-bit word. Bits 0-4: 2-second count, valid range 0-29 inclusive (0-58 seconds). Bits 5-10: Minutes , valid value range 0-59 inclusive. Bits 11-15: Hours, valid range 0-23 inclusive All parameter must be in the valid range, no conversion will be done.
        Parameters:
        hour - last write time hour.
        minute - last write time minute.
        second - last write time second.

        Set the last write time with the actual time.

      • getByte

        public byte[] getByte()
        Return the representation of this class as byte array.
        Returns:
        the directory entry as byte array. The length is a multiple of 32 byte.

        Return the cluster number.
        Returns:
        cluster number.

      • length

        public long length()
        Return the length of the file associated with this directory entry. If it's a directory the file length is 0.
        Returns:
        the length of the file.
